alert.note: Alert for Jack; Young (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 24 at 9:08PM CDT until April 25 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Jack and Young. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell earlier today and an additional 1 inch of rain is possible over the next hour or two. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Graham, Jacksboro, Olney, Bryson and Newcastle.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
